channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Code Maven live
item.description: Live virtual presentations about Perl, Python, and Rust. We are looking for speakers.

item.title: GitLab pipelines and CI for Perl developers
item.description: January 20, 2025, Virtual event in Zoom

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great CPAN modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report.

item.title: Step zero, step one
item.description: I liked the complete solutions in Python including input parameter data type and function return type. Cool, keep sharing.

item.title: Step By Step One Becomes Zero
item.description: The most difficult approach i.e. bit mask. However if you know what you are doing then it is school boy task.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge #302
item.description: Functional approach makes it so easy to follow the logic. Great work, thanks for sharing.

item.title: All about ones
item.description: Using the CPAN power, the job becomes cake walk for anyone. See it yourself to believe.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 302
item.description: Nice hack used to make it easy to deal with the task. Highly recommended.

item.title: fist challenge of the year
item.description: Simple iteration and no gimmicks. Straight forward approach to get the job done. Keep it up great work.

item.title: Optimal Steps
item.description: Do you want to explore PDL? You can take a quick example showing the usage.

item.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 302
item.description: Great show of dynamic programming technique with great detail of discussion. You really don't want to skip it.
Brilliant work showing the power of Perl and Python together. Highly recommended.

item.title: Zero Step
item.description: With lots of Raku magic and plenty of quality comments made it super easy to follow. Great work.

item.title: TWC302
item.description: Mix of CPAN gem and bit of regex magic gives the cool result.

item.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 302
item.description: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Ones and Zeroes" and "Step by Step" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.

item.title: The Weekly Challenge - 303
item.description: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "3-digits Even" and "Delete and Earn". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.

item.title: Add a security policy to your distributions
item.description: If you are CPAN module author then you must give it a thought next time you upload a change or new distribution.

item.title: This week in PSC (174) | 2025-01-02
item.description: Further discussion around the version dump by Aristotle and Graham.

item.title: Exporting to PNG with Codit
item.description: If you have used Codit before then you are going to love this.

item.title: Advent of Code 2024 – 25 Languages
item.description: Perl made it to the list and got 5 stars too by the contributor.

item.title: London Perl Mongers on GitHub Pages
item.description: A great real story how to give fresh life to a historical LondonPM site. It made the process looks so easy that anyone can do it with little help.

item.title: Habemus Perl Logo!
item.description: A colorful variations of new Perl Camel.

item.title: App::Codit
item.description: A new IDE for and in Perl. You must try this and share with others.

item.title: Getopt::Type::Tiny
item.description: One more cool contribution by Curt not on CPAN yet though. Please do give it a try and share your feedbacks.

item.title: #702 - Perl Camel
item.description:
Hi there,

Let us all welcome the new year with Hope and Positivity.

As we bid farewell to the past year, we step forward into a new chapter full of fresh opportunities and untapped potential. The dawn of a new year brings with it a promise of new beginnings, a chance to turn the page on challenges faced and to embrace the joys that lie ahead.

As we all know, we just celebrated 25 years of Perl Advent Calendar, of all the 24 gifts we had this year, my favourite ones: Half My Life with Perl and A New Logo for Perl. As far as the live stream of Randal Schwartz, we were all notified in advance but the surprise entry was the announcement of new Camel for Perl. As per the tradition, we have a public repository where anyone can share ideas and comments: perl-assets. There is even a public channel, #perl-logo under the perlfoundation slack workspace where you can discuss the subject with others. The perl.org site has already adopted the new logo. It is also used in the Perldoc website. OpenCage also used the new logo in the tutorials section.

Talking about Perl Advent Calendar, there is another very popular project: Advent of Code. I came across one very special contribution where the contributor used 25 different programming languages where we had one entry for Perl as well.

For all, London Perl Mongers fan, we now have a new home, thanks to Dave Cross for taking the initiative. I hope we resume the regular meetup too.

Last but not least, please do take care of your physical and mental health. Enjoy rest of the newsletter,
item.dc:subject: editorial
